instructions: # Official Savage Worlds Character Sheet### version 1.0.0## Character Sheet* This is the Official Savage Worlds Character Sheet.* Supports Wild Cards and Extras* Dice rolling* various setting rules## Custom ConfigurationTo configure the sheet to meet your needs, click the crossed hammer and wrench.## Skills* All skills from the SWADE rules are available, with the ability to change their names. To pick your skills, click the crossed hammer and wrench next to the Skills heading and place a check mark next to each skill you'd like to use.* If you need to make a skill an Unskilled roll, you can either use the Unskilled "skill" OR place a -2 in the skill modifier field.## Additional Notes* More info about individual sections can be found in the Documentation wiki.* If there's something you want added, or you'd like to report a bug, feel free to join the Official Savage Worlds Character Sheet Game (https://app.roll20.net/join/8109876/l20ASw). That game has forums for Bug Reports and Enhancement Requests.---

useroptions.description: Set the default icon to designate a Wild Card. Will accept most unicode characters (including emojis--though these may make it difficult to tell a Wild Card from an Extra, because they don't gray out).
This option sets new characters to default as Extras, instead of Wild Cards.
Sets Traits to show an alphanumeric designation for Trait Ranks (e.g. d4, d6, d8, etc) instead of the dice icons
Checking this box will show the Five Core skills (Athletics, Common Knowledge, Notice, Persuastion, and Stealth) by default.
Check this box to automatically set the Attributes (Agility, Smarts, Spirit, Strength, and Vigor) to d6 by default.
Avoids confusion around Fighting costing a skill point to get to d4
Check this box to automatically roll an extra d6 for bonus damage when damage is rolled. This will roll whether the bonus damage should apply or not.
Check this box if most of your characters are not going to have Arcane Backgrounds or need Powers.
Vehicle tab is hidden by default, check this to show the vehicle
Checking this will display a pop-up asking for any modifiers for all rolls made from the character sheet.
Checking this will show any modifiers to a roll at the bottom of the roll template.
Checking this will display a place on the character sheet for custom derived stats.
Checking this will enable the No Power Points Setting Rule
Check this to use the Gritty Damage setting rule. Need to have a rollable table set up for this to work.
If using the Gritty Damage setting rule, this table name is needed and should the name of the rollable table for the Gritty Damage rolls. You will need to be sure to set this up.
